page.title: 14 HAMPRESTON VILLAGE
page.content: The village consists of about 20 buildings including a farm,church and school. Originating in Elizabethan times,today's village was rebuilt in the 1930's.The oldest part of the farm is 400 years old. The 13th.century church has a congregation of one villager and various people from the Ferndown and West Moors area.About 20 years ago there was a village shop. The village school with 74 pupils remains open when nationwide small country schools are being closed. Local development plans as outlined in the Ferndown and West Parley consultative document provide for the preservation of the original character of the village area.
